column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Summon a Waiter Politely
#Text=Showing good manners and class at a restaurant starts with how you deal with the wait staff .
#Text=This varies from place to place , but the rule of thumb is to do it as discreetly as possible .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Raise your hand , but do n't wave .
#Text=Most waiters are very busy but will get to you eventually .
#Text=Be patient if the restaurant is packed .
#Text=The waiter might have many tables to help besides yours .
#Text=Talk to your waiter with respect .
#Text=Control your tone and attitude , a bossy or condescending way of speaking is not needed .
#Text=Never yell or snap your fingers to get attention .
#Text=Make eye contact with the waiter .
#Text=Try to always remain polite .
#Text=If your waiter is ignoring you , be patient , he or she may be busy and stressed out with too much work .
#Text=Remember that if the food does not taste good that the waiter is not responsible ; if the food is cool , then it would be uncommon that the waiting staff is at fault , but it could happen .
#Text=Avoid behaviors that will make your waiter want to pull out his or her hair and give you slow service .
#Text=Changing your mind over dishes after they have been ordered
#Text=Telling your waiter it is time to order than make them stand there for 10 minutes because you really have not decided what you want .
#Text=Drinking too much alcohol
#Text=Harassing other wait staff/customers
#Text=Asking them out on a date
#Text=Talking about your waiter even if he or she is standing right there .
#Text=Ask for separate checks after the waiter bring you the bill or order dessert after the waiter brings the bill
#Text=Asking the waiter to come back over and over again to take your order .
#Text=Grabbing any waiter by the elbow to get service is a big no no .
#Text=Do n't ever touch your waiter !
#Text=Practice good manners when the waiter does arrive at your table and you are with a large party , do not ignore him or her .
#Text=Very rude .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Teach your children to never snap their fingers or scream out to a waiter too .
#Text=It is not cute .
#Text=Be clear if you have a special order and make sure that your waiter understands .
#Text=If you want your steak well done , make sure to specify it in your order .
#Text=Waiters can not mind read or know how you like it .
#Text=If you have horrendous service , complain to the restaurant manager , not to the waiter .
#Text=It is more effective .
#Text=If you do n't like your table , do n't tell the waiter .
#Text=The time to ask for a different table is when the restaurant host sits you down for the meal .
#Text=If you do n't want to be placed near the bathrooms , tell the host/hostess before you start even walking towards the table .
#Text=Or better yet , make a reservation whenever you can and be specific about where you want to be seated .
#Text=Do be courteous if you knock over a drink or your child spills milk .
#Text=Tell the bus boy right away .
#Text=Always ask for a sippy cup for small children .
#Text=Never ignore a spilled drink because someone could fall .
#Text=If you can not get any service , flag down another waiter or even a bus boy .
#Text=If you are bringing hungry children to a busy restaurant , tell your waiter when he first walks up , that you need to have bread or crackers brought with the drinks .
#Text=Try to think of everything you might need when ordering the meal from extra napkins or plates , straws and condiments .
#Text=Plan ahead when you order will save you time and will make you a winner with your waiter .
#Text=Also always bring some toys for small kids to distract them while you wait .
#Text=Address the waiter as " waiter , " not " sir .

#Text=Never call out  Garçon " or " Niño " ( they both mean ' kid or boy in French and Spanish respectively , or the female equivalents either ) .

column1: #Text=Again it is not cute nor funny .
#Text=Save your jokes for someone who is not very busy .
#Text=Do n't send out family members to look for the waiter especially children .
#Text=It is dangerous in a busy restaurant .
#Text=Never scream out or stand up at your table looking for a waiter .
#Text=It is rude !
#Text=Do n't ask your waiters name just so you can shout it out across the room .
#Text=Do n't make up cute nicknames for the wait staff .
#Text=They do n't like it .
